title: Keep Pets Warm Indoors
description: Ensure your pets stay warm inside the house. Provide cozy blankets, soft bedding, and keep them away from cold floors or drafts.
safetyNote: Avoid using space heaters near pets to prevent burns or accidents.

title: Moisturize Dry Skin
description: Cold air can dry out a petâ€™s skin. Use vet-approved moisturizers or coconut oil to keep their coat shiny and skin healthy.
safetyNote: Do not use human lotions, as they may contain ingredients toxic to pets.

title: Protect Paws from Ice and Salt
description: Before walks, apply paw balm or use pet boots to protect paws from road salt and ice burns. Wipe their paws after returning home.
safetyNote: Salt and antifreeze can be harmful if licked off, so always clean paws properly.

title: Keep Pets Hydrated Indoors
description: Even in winter, pets need plenty of water. Make sure fresh water is always available and consider using a pet fountain to encourage drinking.
safetyNote: Ensure water bowls are clean and refill frequently to prevent bacteria growth.
